metadata.title: Certificates of Occupancy — Requirements, Temporary Certificates, and Apartment House Licenses
metadata.source: SF Building Inspection Commission Code (SFBICC), Section 109A
notes: No building may be used or occupied until the Building Official issues a certificate
Temporary certificates are valid for up to 12 months
Apartment house/hotel licenses are required for all R-1 and R-2 occupancies
Amended certificates track changes in dwelling unit count

use_and_occupancy.rule: No building or structure shall be used or occupied, and no change in existing occupancy classification shall be made, until the Building Official has issued a certificate of final completion and occupancy or an amended certificate, or the use has otherwise been approved by DBI.
use_and_occupancy.disclaimer: Issuance of a certificate shall not be construed as approval of any code violation. The Police Department shall enforce this provision when called upon by the Building Official.

change_in_occupancy.description: Changes in the character or use of a building must follow SF Existing Building Code Section 407. A certificate is required for changes in use or occupancy as set forth in Section 407.
change_in_occupancy.exception: Group R-1 and R-2 occupancies are subject to Sections 109A.7 and 109A.8 instead.

when_issued: Buildings or structures erected or enlarged
Each change in occupancy classification in any building, structure, or portion
Buildings or structures seismically upgraded per code

amended_certificate.trigger: Existing building where there is an increase in the number of legal dwelling units resulting in a change of occupancy
amended_certificate.must_include: Date of first certificate of occupancy and any subsequent certificates
amended_certificate.no_original: If no original certificate exists, the amended certificate shall refer to the date of initial construction on file

certificate_issued.zoning_restriction: These provisions are not available in RH-1 or RH-1(D) zoning districts, nor for any residential dwelling inconsistent with existing law.
certificate_issued.exception: For R-1 and R-2 occupancies, see Sections 109A.7 and 109A.8.

conditions: Building Official finds no substantial hazard will result from occupancy before completion
Satisfactory evidence that work could not have been completed prior to occupancy
temporary_certificate.request_method: Written request required. No occupancy until temporary certificate is issued.
temporary_certificate.extension: Extension of time may be approved by the Building Official

grounds: Building or structure found to be in violation of any code or ordinance
revocation.method: In writing by the Building Official

r1_r2_certificate.title: Certificate of Final Completion and Occupancy for Group R-1 and R-2 Occupancies
r1_r2_certificate.description: Before DBI may issue a certificate for newly-erected R-1/R-2 buildings, amended certificates for existing buildings per Section 109A.3, or Apartment House/Hotel Licenses, a written compliance report must be obtained from all agencies having jurisdiction.
amended_certificate_must_include: Date of first certificate and any subsequent certificates
If no original exists, the date of initial construction on file
r1_r2_certificate.board_of_appeals: Where any permit was appealed to the Board of Appeals with conditions imposed, DBI may not issue a certificate until conditions are met. A copy of the certificate shall be forwarded to the Board.

apartment_house_hotel_license.title: Group R-1 and R-2 Occupancy — Apartment House/Hotel License
apartment_house_hotel_license.requirement: A license is required for every Group R-1 and R-2 occupancy structure.
apartment_house_hotel_license.fee_table: Table 1A-P — Apartment House and Hotel License Fees
apartment_house_hotel_license.note: New license must be applied for by the new owner within 30 days of change of ownership.
apartment_house_hotel_license.disclaimer: The license shall not be construed as authority to violate, cancel, alter, or set aside any provision of any law or ordinance.
